column5: On the weekend I barely noticed some water across from what I think is either Forest Estates or a place we called Lockheart as kids. I may have been there as a kid I may have not been, it's been that long.  Is anyone familiar with that water?  Something tells me there is nothing or if it is fish able it is a treasure chest filled with bass and maybe pike.  Directions to it would be appreciated also,
I think it might be Park Haven Lake?    That's the only water you can see from the 401 in that area as far as I recall.   I've seen people boating on it recently.   Don't know much about it though.
Lots of info on park haven lake via Google.
Park Haven has Largemouth and Pike that I have caught but haven't been in a while.

You are correct and that is the water that catches everyone's, but when coming back from Guelph on Saturday I seen a body of water across the 401 from the park. I know of one or two other well hidden holes in that area. I have a strong hunch about this one, but would love to know if anyone else has ventured back there.  With the price of gas......may not need to finish,

Yes there is a lake/pon a little further west on the opposite side of the 401 from Park Haven. I see a dock in there but have never accessed it and I don't think there  is public access.  Looks like its called Fowlers Pond.
the spot **I believe** you are referring to does not have public access.
Never ceases to amaze me.  Thank you folks,
The pond on the south east side is known as lockheart. Fished there many times.  I have a trailer @ park haven, it is a private lake with no public access .
